From Google Translate

The Korea Football Association (KFA) has appointed former Hong Kong national team coach Kim Pang-gon (48) as the newly appointed chairman and vice chairman of the newly appointed national coach. He also appointed Yoo Dae-woo, director of the future strategic planning group, and Kim Sung-nam, Hwaseong FC director, in the communication department. The Korea Football Association (KFA) held a board meeting at the soccer hall on the 26th and reported the results of the personnel affairs.

The national election committee is a subcommittee that manages and supports the national and international teams. They also have the authority to appoint and dismiss the national team. In addition to strengthening the power of the national teams ahead of the Russian World Cup next year, the Women's Asian Cup and Jakarta Asian Games, the appointment of the 2020 Olympic Games in Tokyo will be an immediate task.

Chairperson Kim Pang-gon graduated from Masan Chang-hwa and Honam University, and played in Ulsan and Jeonbuk in the early 1990s as a professional player. He moved to Hong Kong in 2000 and spent four years playing with a local club team. From 2005 to 2008, he served as Senior Coach and Supervisor at Busan I'Park, and as Senior Coach at Kyungnam FC in 2011. Since 2012, he has been working as a technical chairperson in the Hong Kong national team and youth team. He was called Hong Kong's Hiddink by leading the Hong Kong national team and achieving remarkable achievements at various competitions. The council members to be assisted by the chairperson Kim Pang-gon and the association discussed and decided to commission later.

As for the appointment of Chairman Kim, the Korea Football Association (KFA) said, "I did not spend my time as a player but I think that the qualities necessary for leadership capacity and administrative duties are fully verified. Soccer players who have not experienced national athletes are meaningful because they have created a case where they can take on any important role if they are capable. "

On the other hand, the board of directors decided on the budget of the Korea Football Association (KFA) in 2018 for 97.52 billion won. It is 25% more than the 777 billion won in 2017. In addition, he decided to pay the athletes' prize money in the amount of 2.5 billion won after the final round of the Russian World Cup finals.

KFA News Team
